issue.title: [Fix] Reuse event loop logic

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes
`asyncio.get_running_loop()` throws a `RuntimeError: There is no current event loop in thread 'MainThread'` when this is no current event loop.

Resolves issue introduced in #10164.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
Closes #10452

## Testing Plan
- Unit Tests (JS and/or Python): Added ‚úÖ 
- Manual Testing: ‚úÖ

body:
Hi @paul-gauthier, thanks so much for bringing this to our attention!
Was able to repro and have started on a fix in PR #[10455](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/10455)
@paul-gauthier We fixed the issue and rolled out a patch yesterday (1.42.2). Do you still get the exception with Streamlit `1.42.2`?

issue.title: Add visualization of model weights over time
issue.body:
Closes #28. Makes it so that you can drag a slider to see the weights of a model update across epochs:

Summary of changes:
* defines a `visualize_state_dict_at_epoch` function in `apps/fourier_transformer_viewer/streamlit_vis.py` that takes a multidimensional state dict (`dict[str, Tensor]`) where all tensors are 3-dimensional (first dim is epoch dim), and returns a plotly figure with a slider. *IMPORTANT: the plotly figure already generates the plots of weights at every epoch, so the slider is just showing/hiding various plots. This all happens within the plotly figure (in javascript), so it is all on the frontent, so it is really fast. Does NOT work at all to make a streamlit slider, then recompute the plotly figure on slider change (lag of 2-3 seconds per slider drag)*
* Create a new, clean dataset of 2 trained functions (temporarily edit the number of functions to 2 in the `bulk_train_cuda` make recipe
* Downgrade streamlit to `v1.41` (from `v1.42`) to get rid of warning messages. See [this core streamlit issue](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/10452) for details
* Add deepcopy directive to `get_save_dict()` in `SaveableModule`. This ensures that if you copy state dicts every epoch while training you will actually keep distinct copies rather than a reference to the same set of updating parameters

body: Thanks for the quick fix. As I mentioned, I don't have a way to reproduce. I will unpin the streamlit dependency in my next release and monitor for end-users reporting errors.

I‚Äôm encountering the following error when running my Streamlit app in version `1.43.2`:

```bash
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/streamlit/web/bootstrap.py", line 345, in run
    if asyncio.get_running_loop().is_running():
       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
RuntimeError: no running event loop
```

This started happening after introducing the following code to lazily load a SentenceTransformer model:

```python
from sentence_transformers import SentenceTransformer
import torch

from .base import EmbeddingGenerator


class SentenceTransformerEmbeddingGenerator(EmbeddingGenerator):
    """Embedding generator for Sentence Transformer models."""

    def __init__(self, model_name):
        """
        Initialize the Sentence Transformer embedding generator.

        Args:
            model_name (str): The name of the Sentence Transformer model to use
        """
        self.model_name = model_name
        # Initialize the client without specifying device to avoid Streamlit watcher issues
        self.client = None

    def generate(self, query_text):
        """
        Generate embeddings using Sentence Transformer model.

        Args:
            query_text (str): The text to generate embeddings for

        Returns:
            list: The embedding vector
        """
        # Lazy-load the model when it's actually needed
        if self.client is None:
            # Select device based on availability
            device = 'cpu'  # Default to CPU
            try:
                if torch.backends.mps.is_available():
                    device = "mps"
                elif torch.cuda.is_available():
                    device = "cuda"
            except:
                # If there's any error checking device, fall back to CPU
                pass
                
            self.client = SentenceTransformer(self.model_name, device=device)
            
        # Generate the embedding
        response = self.client.encode(
            sentences=query_text,
            convert_to_numpy=True  # Use numpy to avoid torch tensor issues
        )
        
        # Convert to list for serialization
        return response.tolist()
```

Streamlit might be clashing with the way asyncio or background threads are handled during model initialization ‚Äî possibly triggered by how sentence-transformers interacts with torch or transformers under the hood.

issue.title: Trying to import torch results in asyncio RuntimeError

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

I have a working Streamlit app. If I modify it to add `import torch`, I get a `RuntimeError` related to asyncio.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import streamlit as st
import torch

pg = st.navigation([
    st.Page("app/home.py", title="Home"),
])

pg.run()
```

### Steps To Reproduce

Simply try to run this app with `streamlit run app.py`.

### Expected Behavior

The app should run normally and I should be able to use torch like any other library.

### Current Behavior

This is what I get:

```sh
$ streamlit run app.py 

  You can now view your Streamlit app in your browser.

  Local URL: http://localhost:8501
  Network URL: http://192.168.1.12:8501

2025-04-01 16:26:00.500 Examining the path of torch.classes raised:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/streamlit/web/bootstrap.py", line 347, in run
    if asyncio.get_running_loop().is_running():
       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
RuntimeError: no running event loop

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/streamlit/watcher/local_sources_watcher.py", line 217, in get_module_paths
    potential_paths = extract_paths(module)
                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File ".../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/streamlit/watcher/local_sources_watcher.py", line 210, in <lambda>
    lambda m: list(m.__path__._path),
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File ".../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/torch/_classes.py", line 13, in __getattr__
    proxy = torch._C._get_custom_class_python_wrapper(self.name, attr)
            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
RuntimeError: Tried to instantiate class '__path__._path', but it does not exist! Ensure that it is registered via torch::class_
```

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.44.0
- Torch version: 2.6.0
- Python version: 3.11.11
- Operating System: macOS 15.4
- Browser: Safari 18.4


### Additional Information

Possibly related issues:
- https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/10452
- https://github.com/pytorch/torchchat/issues/1033

issue.title: RuntimeError: no running event loop

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

We got the following exception. We started seeing this when we updated streamlit version from 1.45.1 to 1.46.0. Here is the error:

  File "/layers/devx-buildpacks_python/python/lib/python3.12/site-packages/streamlit/web/bootstrap.py", line 348, in run
    if asyncio.get_running_loop().is_running():
       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
RuntimeError: no running event loop



We can see the timing of this error starting up after we deployed a PR that was updating streamlit version, eg
before: streamlit==1.45.1
after: streamlit==1.46.0

We noticed streamlit has some issues that sounds like the same symptom, eg
https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/10452 "v1.42.0 introduces call to asyncio.get_event_loop().is_running() which sometimes throws RuntimeError"
Apparently fixed in https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/10455  on Feb 20

Maybe that fix was reverted?


### Reproducible Code Example

```Python

```

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

_No response_

_No response_
